snippet: After the first round of peace negotiations ended with little progress, the United Nations mediator, Lakhdar Brahimi, resumed the talks in cautious style.
abstract: Representatives of Syria's government and opposition open a second round in the fragile peace process as humanitarian agencies continue to evacuate civilians from the besieged Old City of Homs under a cease-fire negotiated in the first round.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: After the first round of peace negotiations ended with little progress, the United Nations mediator, Lakhdar Brahimi, resumed the talks in cautious style.

headline.main: As Second Round of Syrian Talks Begins, U.N.’s Mediator Steps Cautiously
headline.print_headline: As Second Round of Syrian Talks Begin, U.N.’s Mediator Steps Cautiously
